speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: We interrupt this program for a breaking news bulletin.

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: 90 miles and counting-- that's how far officers of the Nevada highway patrol have pursued the blue car on your screen in a wild chase right through the heart of Elko at speeds approaching 100 miles an hour.

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: Live on the scene in Carlin is Chuck Pickering in the Fox 11 news chopper. Chuck, what can you tell us?

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: Benjamin, we're heading west following route 766, where it feeds off the I-80. Now, just under an hour ago, troopers attempted to pull over the blue car which we understand is stolen. That occurred on the 80, east of Wells. Since then, this driver has stopped for nothing and nobody.

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: Any word yet on who the driver is?

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: None at this time. What we do think, though and what we've passed on to the Highway Patrol is that from our vantage point we've seen another person in that car. See, right there. A hand. It just moved. See, in the back seat? Now, we could possibly have a hostage situation here. And, obviously, the sooner they bring this vehicle to a stop ….

speaker: PATROLMAN
line: Unit six, ready at milepost 13.

speaker: PATROLMAN 2
line: Coming your way, six.

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: Well, that did the trick. The automobile seems to be coming to a stop.

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: Chuck, what did they just use there?

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: It looked to be a special tire-puncturing chain. And now the officers are approaching the car. One of them has opened the door, and he has hold of the suspect. He's pulling him out. He doesn't seem to have a weapon.

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: He may not be armed but from our vantage point, it looks like he doesn't want to get out of that car.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Vicky! Vicky!

speaker: VICKY CRUMP
line: Please get it out of my head.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Vicky! Vicky! No! Let me go! Let me go! Vicky! No! Let me go! I got to go! Vicky! No!

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: ...Hostage appears to be okay. The Highway Patrol has her now. But Chuck, it looks like that driver is still fighting.

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: Yes. He's definitely putting up a bit of a fight. He seems to be a man with a few choice words on the subject as you can see. They're trying to restrain him. I tell you what. We're going to move back and try to get a wider angle. See, there's the woman …. What the heck? She's ….

speaker: CRUMP
line: Vicky! Vicky!

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: There, see? She's banging her head against the window.

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: What the hell just happened?

speaker: STUDIO DIRECTOR
line: CUT! CUT! CUT!

speaker: FARMER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, Virgil Nokes? I'm Agent Scully. This is Agent Mulder. We're with the FBI.

speaker: FARMER
line: Jehovah's Witness?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. Federal Bureau of Investigation.

line: But we do have a free copy of the Watchtower for you if you'd like.

line: Uh, sir, this is just a routine check but, uh, we understand that you recently placed an order for 5,000 pounds of ammonium nitrate fertilizer.

speaker: FARMER
line: Oh, you people. Come on in.

speaker: REPORTER
line: ...with the President. She's said to have admitted to an 18-month affair...

speaker: FARMER
line: Sugar beets.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me?

speaker: FARMER
line: I grow sugar beets.

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... authorities in Riverside County, California …

speaker: FARMER
line: I figure I got better things to do with my fertilizer than going around blowing government buildings sky high.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Well, as we said, sir this is just routine.

speaker: MULDER
line: So routine, it numbs the mind.

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... Experts credit a healthy economy …

speaker: FARMER
line: I got my AG card and my papers 'round here somewhere.

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... a strange death on a Nevada highway.

speaker: FARMER
line: Help me look for them, will you?

speaker: REPORTER
line: ... As we reported earlier a wild police pursuit ended in tragedy this morning with the death of a 36-year-old female hostage. This was the scene west of Elko, Nevada, one hour ago...

line: Hey, Scully, take a look at this.

line: ......died mysteriously while in custody. We once again want to warn our viewers this footage is extremely graphic.

speaker: CHOPPER REPORTER
line: Now the hostage is still inside the car. It appears that she is banging her head against the window …

speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
line: At this time, highway patrol officials are refusing to identify the woman or to speculate on how she died. …. Though they do stress it was not the result of a gunshot. ….. Coroner's report is not expected for a day or more. Meanwhile residents of Northern Nevada who first witnessed….

line: Thank you, Captain. That's no problem. We'd be happy to help. Mm-hmm.

line: We'll be happy to help what?

speaker: MULDER
line: See you soon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we're not going to Nevada.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. Just one quick side trip.

line: No. Sorry, Mulder. We have a whole new assignment.

line: Look, Mulder, like it or not, humiliated or not, we're on domestic terrorism now and, yes, this is... This is a punishment but if we want to get back to where we want to be we have to follow orders. We can't freelance.

line: You saw that news report. What did you make of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think that the obvious assumption is that the woman was shot, regardless of what the police say. Maybe it was a sniper.

speaker: MULDER
line: In the words of their captain "she just sort of popped." And what about this guy who supposedly tried to take her hostage, her husband? Looked to me like he was trying to warn the cops before she died. Now, the sun will rise in America tomorrow regardless of whether or not we're at yet another farm investigating yet another enormous pile of doo-doo. We can be in and out in a day. Nobody has to know.

line: S-s-somebody! Please! It's starting! Somebody!

line: Why can't we see him?

line: Well, hopefully later. He pitched quite a fit in his cell-- screaming a bunch of nonsense that we were going to kill him the way we killed his wife. You know, he's not a particularly stable individual.

line: He's getting it. Our doctor's with him now. I mean, after whatever happened to his wife-- which I'd like to stress was not our fault-- we're not going to take any chances, you know?

line: Patrick Garland Crump of Montello, Nevada.

line: 40-year-old roofer. No history of mental illness. No prior record.

line: He's got one now. That Barracuda he jacked on the Utah state line? He yanked some teenager out of the window threw his wife in back and took off. Excuse me.

line: I'm thinking while we're here I might take a look at Mr. Crump's wife.

line: I'm going to stay here and see if I can see Crump.

line: So that's where it started. That's Crump's home. Then he headed east in this direction on the 5 about ten miles to the Utah border where he stole the car.

line: That's here.

line: There's no gunpowder residue... No carbon stippling. There seems to be no evidence of an entry wound whatsoever.

speaker: CORONER
line: There is none. It's all exit, but how that could be...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm finding what look like fragments of petrous bone embedded in the remaining portion of the auditory canal. In fact, I seem to be looking straight through to the osseous labyrinth or what's left of it.

speaker: CORONER
line: It's almost like a little bomb went off in her ear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: May I?

speaker: CORONER
line: Please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There seems to be some kind of tumefaction within the lateral sinus.

speaker: EMT
line: Patient is a white male, age 40, no known history...

line: No, he just went rammy on me. Accucheck is normal. We did a narcan push but he keeps getting worse. Okay. IV beta blocker and topical nitro.

line: I don't know if you're going to get to talk to this fella after all.

speaker: EMT
line: Five's a crowd, buddy.

speaker: EMT
line: Whoa. Something must have worked. Heart rate's dropping.

speaker: EMT 2
line: BP's headed south. I don't understand; what'd you just do?

speaker: EMT
line: Hell if I know but I'll take it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God. Come on, Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, you, out! This lab is quarantined. Go! Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. You know how to pick them, I'll tell you that. Look, I have no idea what killed this woman but I have to assume it's communicable.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Another body has been found just outside of Montello --- same apparent cause of death - some kind of massive aneurysm or rupture.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Mulder, I've called the CDC. They're on their way but Patrick Crump may be infected. So you need to quarantine his cell and make sure that anybody who's had any close contact with him whatsoever has been quarantined as well, and that means you, Mulder. You're to have no contact with him whatsoever.

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

line: Well, that's going to be a little tough, Scully.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Drive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are they?

line: Route 789, heading west. We're keeping them in visual plus we're in phone contact not to mention the strings we pulled to keep this off local TV.

line: Where are they going?

line: Crump won't say. Wherever it is, though, he ain't getting there.

line: Roadblock?

line: We'll shut him down east of Tuscarora-- nice, clean, remote space we can own.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right. I want the CDC on-site. I want the officers making the arrest to be wearing level two or better anti-contamination suits. I want the car decontaminated. I want Agent Mulder and Crump decontaminated. I want them quarantined separately.

line: You got it.

line: Crump says that if we don't pull back our escort he's going to shoot your partner.

line: You just leave me the hell alone! Now!

line: How about if we just pull over and let me out, too, huh? I must be cramping your style.

line: Just... Shut up. It's you people. Figures.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Shut up.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Shut up.

line: Oh, God. Man, if we get stopped...

line: Subject's turning off 789 about a mile east of your position and is heading north on a fire road. Looks like he's going to miss you.

line: Say what?

line: What's the report, Captain?

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: They lost them. They were last seen on a forestry service road. Trees were too thick. Our helicopter lost sight of them.

line: How did Crump know to avoid the roadblock?

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: That's the question. I was hoping your Agent Mulder would manage to steer him toward it, but...

speaker: CAPTAIN

line: Agent Scully, I've got the cell cultures from the second victim.

line: No, no. Not necessarily. I mean, something killed these people.

speaker: SCULLY

line: Agent Scully.

line: Yes, sir.

line: Sir, I am not currently in the state of Idaho.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: No, you're not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In the course of prosecuting our assignment in Idaho, Agent Mulder and I came across a situation in Nevada which we both strongly felt needed our immediate attention.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: I eagerly await your report. In the meantime, agents of our Las Vegas field office will be available to assist you in tracking down Agent Mulder.

line: Thank you, sir.

line: Oh, Agent Scully... I think, at this point I want to see him alive even more than you do.

line: Can I see that for a minute? This man worked at Silver State Power reading meters.

speaker: CORONER
line: Yes.

line: What if he read the meter at Vicky Crump's place?

line: Crump? Crump, what else can you tell me about what's happening to you?

line: Mr. Crump. You call me by my last name, you say "mister" in front of it.

line: "Mister." I got you.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Not Crump. Mr. Crump.

line: You know, what kind of name is Mulder, anyway? What is that, like... like, Jewish?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me?

line: What do you mean?

line: I can't... I can't go... I can't go left. There's only trees there. Crump.

line: Crump... It's west. Huh, west? You got to head west. It's just like you did with your wife. You took her and you headed west. It's not just motion; it has to be in one direction. Is that right? What the hell happened to you?

line: Okay, I want a thorough search with an eye to the usual disease vectors.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You got it.

line: I think we're witnessing the same pathology here.

line: We need to get a blood sample.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's go.

line: Try to hold him still!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hang on. Let me sedate him.

speaker: MULDER
line: One more time. You woke up this morning… then what?

speaker: CRUMP
line: We have been through this.

speaker: MULDER
line: You woke up this morning but you didn't go to work. Why?

speaker: CRUMP
line: It was raining. You don't shingle in the rain. I was up at 6:00, reading the paper.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was your wife doing?

speaker: CRUMP
line: Cooking, man. Breakfast. She was just putting breakfast on the table when the...

speaker: MULDER
line: You looked up.

line: I looked up, and I saw that she had this nosebleed she didn't even know she had.

speaker: MULDER
line: What caused it?

speaker: CRUMP
line: What do I... I'm... I'm, like, Quincy? How the hell should I know what caused it? It just happened. Ten, 15 minutes later, she just... Starts getting sick. Said she got a headache that just... keeps getting worse and worse. Then she starts... screaming. I didn't know what the hell to do. I just, uh... I got her in the truck and... Taking her to the hospital but then it seemed like the faster we went the better she'd do but just as soon as I try to slow down or stop...

line: I'm sorry about your wife.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Sure, you are... You and the rest of your Jew FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Crump...

speaker: CRUMP
line: Oh, yeah. You think I don't know, huh? You think I'm just some ignorant pudknocker, don't you? But I get it, man! I see what this is! I am not sick and I do not have the flu. Vicky and me were just some kind of... Government guinea pigs.

line: You think the government did this to you?

speaker: CRUMP
line: Hell, yeah. Who else? You see it all the time on the TV: they're dropping Agent Orange, they're putting radiation in little retarded kids' gonads... Oh, yeah. You sons of bitches sneaking around my woods at night-- I seen you. You think I don't know?

line: Well, on behalf of the international Jewish conspiracy I just need to inform you that we're... almost out of gas.

line: The trailer looks clean-- no readily apparent vectors.

line: Dogs, housewives... Whatever this thing is, it doesn't discriminate.

line: Look at that.

line: Hello! Hello?

line: Doctor? Hello? Hello?

line: Oh, no. It's okay, ma'am.

line: It's all right. I'm sorry.

line: Go away! Go away!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay. It's okay.

line: Okay, Crump, we got about one more mile. I'll make it fast. You ready? Here goes nothing.

line: Hey, turn on the pump! Number four! Three! Number three! Turn it on!

line: You got to pay before you pump, buddy!

line: Hey, dammit, that's my car! Where the hell do you think you're going?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: What... What are you doing?

line: The pathology of this thing... It affects the inner ear and this area right here is ground zero. What if what we're looking for is some kind of a sound?

line: Oh. Excuse me. Scully.

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: It's Van Gelder. Agent, I don't know what the hell your partner's thinking but not only is he actively evading my officers, now he's stolen a car.

line: Come again?

line: "Crump sick; will die if stopped same as wife. Must head west to keep alive. No roadblocks!" Exclamation point. This make any sense to you?

line: You got to go faster. It's getting worse.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay.

line: Yeah, yeah. That's good. Okay. Hey, uh... The Jew stuff? No offense. I mean, uh... A man can't help who he's born to.

line: That was an apology, right? Gee, I don't know if I can see to drive my eyes are tearing up so bad.

line: Whatever, man. Why are you doing this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why am I doing what?

line: It's not in your best interest to make me question that right now.

line: How do I know you ain't doing exactly what they want you to? Hmm? Driving me all around creation, experimenting on me... How do I know it ain't that?

line: I guess you don't.

line: Hey, you got to stay alive if you want to stick it to the government. If you die, you let them off the hook. Am I right? Huh?

line: Lieutenant Breil? My name is Dana Scully. I called in regard to the electrical equipment the Navy is maintaining in the town of Montello.

line: Right. I don't know if there's been some miscommunication between you and your Washington office, but, uh...

line: OKAY. AT 6:17 yesterday morning during a test of our ground conduction radio system a situation arose in which our equipment experienced a brief power surge. line: The specifics of what we do here are classified, ma'am.

line: Sure, sure. Um... Would you happen to know what effect such a surge might have on, uh... On an organism... Say, a... Say, a human being? Theoretically speaking.

line: Crump?

speaker: CRUMP
line: Mr. Crump.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Crump...

speaker: CRUMP
line: What is it, Mr. Mulder?

line: Mulder, are you okay?

line: Yeah, aside from terminal cell phone withdrawal... That, and I got to pee. Where are you?

line: I'm just about to board a justice department jet... Hopefully, I'll overshoot you.

line: I don't know, Mulder. You tell me.

line: I'm guessing wherever the hell route 36 ends but we can't stop, Scully. I'm kind of at a loss as to what to do next.

line: Well, I think I have a loose theory as to what caused this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, lay it on me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Mulder, you know what ELF waves are? Extremely low radio transmissions?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. It uses an antenna, like, 50 miles long. The military uses it to communicate with the trident submarines, Project Seafarer, Project Haarp.

line: Well, Seafarer has an antenna array stretching beneath the edge of Patrick Crump's property. Now, ELF fields have been shown to... To produce biological effects in human tissue inducing electrical currents, altering chemical reactions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not to mention that as a potential weapons application it's been referred to as "electrical nerve gas" or may be behind the so-called "Taos Hum."

line: What if some overload some... Some hum from this system could somehow match the resonant frequency of the human skull? I mean, what if it could induce a like hum that could... That could somehow exert a rising pressure on the labyrinth of the inner ear in a sense shattering it?

speaker: MULDER
line: But with constant movement somehow ameliorating that pressure making it bearable. But why only westward movement?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, Mulder, I don't know. I mean... I mean, maybe it has to follow certain lines of force electrical or magnetic. I mean, maybe...

speaker: MULDER
line: The big question, Scully, is what do we do about it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think I know, Mulder, but it's nothing that Mr. Crump is going to like.

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll be there.

speaker: CRUMP
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, whether they did this to you intentionally or not, you were right. They did it to you.

speaker: CRUMP
line: So, what do we... what do we do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your one chance is that we meet my partner at the end of the highway. There, she will insert a long, large-bore needle into your inner ear hopefully relieving the pressure. Now, when we get there she's going to have to work fast. She's only going to have one chance. She's not going to be able to use any anesthetic and it will probably leave you deaf.

speaker: CRUMP
line: But I'll live, right? Well, that's what it's all about. All right, man. Let's do it. Mr. Mulder, could you go a little faster, please? Just a little more is all I need.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure.

speaker: CRUMP
line: Go a little faster, please? Just a little bit faster.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get ready!

speaker: AD KERSH
line: "Justice department jet: 2.6 turbine hours round trip at Compensation to one Walter R. Duncan for unauthorized use of

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you bill me?

speaker: AD KERSH
line: I'll bill your partner instead. You two obviously relish the role of martyr.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. So are we done here? Back to the bozo work investigating huge piles of manure?

speaker: AD KERSH
line: You can always quit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, Agent Mulder has been through a lot.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: And you apologize for him a lot. I've noticed that about you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not apologizing for this. Because of his work, the DOD is shutting down their antenna array in northeastern Nevada. Our participation in this case has saved lives.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: I don't see you proving that. The Department of Defense admits no culpability whatsoever. Furthermore, they say the closing of the facility was coincidental.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right.

speaker: AD KERSH
line: Don't misunderstand me, Agent. I don't care if you and your partner saved a school bus full of doe-eyed urchins on their way to Sunday bible camp. You no longer investigate X-Files. You are done and the sooner you and Mulder come to recognize that, the better for both of you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Big piles of manure.
